topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Brighton Bathing Box Time Machine
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories are revealed to be actual historical events witnessed from a Tardis-like Brighton bathing box.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes mundane beach huts with wild, time-travelling adventures based on tall tales.

ideas.title: Nana vs. The Giant Port Phillip Bay Squid
ideas.premise: Nana recounts a legendary battle with a giant squid, illustrated as a kaiju movie poster parody, fought near St Kilda Pier.
ideas.why_funny: Exaggerated storytelling trope meets iconic Melbourne location for absurd imagery.

ideas.title: Seagull Subtitles
ideas.premise: A cartoon depicts Nana narrating her saltwater stories, while a seagull provides sarcastic subtitles for modern audiences.
ideas.why_funny: Seagull represents the cynical, younger generation's reaction to old stories.

ideas.title: The Fairy Penguin Witness Protection Program
ideas.premise: Nana reveals that her saltwater stories involve protecting tiny fairy penguins hiding from dangerous criminals.
ideas.why_funny: Involves cute penguins, a crime storyline and Nana being an unlikely protector.

ideas.title: Flinders Street Station Seagull Swap
ideas.premise: Nana claims her tall tales stem from swapping places with a seagull at Flinders Street Station as a child.
ideas.why_funny: Playing on the stereotype of large seagull populations in the city centre.

ranking: The Brighton Bathing Box Time Machine
Nana vs. The Giant Port Phillip Bay Squid
The Fairy Penguin Witness Protection Program
winner: The Brighton Bathing Box Time Machine
